items.title: Spinoffs Outperforming the S&P 500 Boost the Case for Breakups
items.description: (Bloomberg) -- The pace of spinoffs in the US is set to accelerate in 2025, and if history is any guide, the newly created companies are poised to deliver solid returns for investors, according to a report from Trivariate Research.Most Read from BloombergIs This Weird Dome the Future of Watching Sports?NYC’s Subway Violence Deters Drive to Bring Workers Back to OfficeDon’t Shrink the BusNYC Congestion Pricing to Take Effect After Years of DelaysNYC Congestion Pricing Takes Effect After Years of

items.title: Carrier: Fairly Valued After Transition Nears Completion
items.description: Carrier has transformed into a near pure play HVAC business, driven by strategic acquisitions and divestments. Read why I remain neutral on CARR stock.

items.title: Centerview Partners Considers a Deal of Its Own After Record Year
items.description: The boutique bank, long seen as a holdout, could sell a stake after recent interest from big investors.

items.title: Next-Generation Catalysts Market to Reach US$ 3,585.4 Million by 2034 with a CAGR of 5.7% | Fact.MR Report
items.author: Fact.Mr
items.description: The global next-generation catalysts market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 5.7% and reach US$ 3,585.4 million by 2034, driven by strict environmental regulations, the need for energy efficiency, and growing demand for high-value chemicals. The Asia-Pacific region is a key market, followed by Europe and North America.
